abstract: Examination of cellphone used by Amtrak engineer Brandon Bostian during time of deadly rail crash in Philadelphia in May 2015 provides no evidence that he was on phone at time of accident; whether or not Bostian was distracted by phone before accident has played key part in investigation.
lead_paragraph: The National Transportation Safety Board has been looking at cellphone use as a possible factor in the train derailment that killed eight people last month.

headline.main: No Evidence That Amtrak Engineer Used Phone During Crash, Safety Board Says
headline.print_headline: No Evidence That Amtrak Engineer Used Phone During Crash, Safety Board Says

snippet: The National Transportation Safety Board has been looking at cellphone use as a possible factor in the train derailment that killed eight people last month.
